verses.verse: Before the decree is issued, Or the day passes like chaff, Before the LORD’s fierce anger comes upon you, Before the day of the LORD’s anger comes upon you!

(Ps. 105:4; Amos 5:6) Seek the LORD, (Ps. 76:9) all you meek of the earth, Who have upheld His justice. Seek righteousness, seek humility. (Joel 2:14; Amos 5:14, 15) It may be that you will be hidden In the day of the LORD’s anger.
(Judgment on Nations) For (Jer. 47:1, 5; Amos 1:7, 8; Zech. 9:5) Gaza shall be forsaken, And Ashkelon desolate; They shall drive out Ashdod (Jer. 6:4) at noonday, And Ekron shall be uprooted.

Woe to the inhabitants of (Ezek. 25:15-17) the seacoast, The nation of the Cherethites! The word of the LORD is against you, O (Josh. 13:3) Canaan, land of the Philistines: “I will destroy you; So there shall be no inhabitant.”
The seacoast shall be pastures, With shelters for shepherds (Is. 17:2) and folds for flocks.

The coast shall be for ((Mic. 5:7, 8)) the remnant of the house of Judah; They shall feed their flocks there; In the houses of Ashkelon they shall lie down at evening. For the LORD their God will (Luke 1:68) intervene for them, And (Jer. 29:14) return their captives.

“I (Jer. 48:27; Amos 2:1-3) have heard the reproach of Moab, And (Ezek. 25:3; Amos 1:13) the insults of the people of Ammon, With which they have reproached My people, And (Jer. 49:1) made arrogant threats against their borders.

Therefore, as I live,” Says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, “Surely (Is. 15:1-9; Jer. 48:1-47) Moab shall be like Sodom, And (Amos 1:13) the people of Ammon like Gomorrah— (Deut. 29:23) Overrun with weeds and saltpits, And a perpetual desolation. The residue of My people shall plunder them, And the remnant of My people shall possess them.”
This they shall have (Is. 16:6) for their pride, Because they have reproached and made arrogant threats Against the people of the LORD of hosts.

The LORD will be awesome to them, For He will reduce to nothing all the gods of the earth; (Mal. 1:11) People shall worship Him, Each one from his place, Indeed all (Gen. 10:5) the shores of the nations.
“You (Is. 18:1-7; Ezek. 30:4, 5) Ethiopians also, You shall be slain by (Ps. 17:13) My sword.”
And He will stretch out His hand against the north, (Is. 10:5-27; 14:24-27; Mic. 5:5, 6) Destroy Assyria, And make Nineveh a desolation, As dry as the wilderness.

The herds shall lie down in her midst, (Is. 13:21) Every beast of the nation. Both the (Is. 14:23; 34:11) pelican and the bittern Shall lodge on the capitals of her pillars; Their voice shall sing in the windows; Desolation shall be at the threshold; For He will lay bare the (Jer. 22:14) cedar work.

This is the rejoicing city (Is. 47:8) That dwelt securely, (Rev. 18:7) That said in her heart, “I am it, and there is none besides me.” How has she become a desolation, A place for beasts to lie down! Everyone who passes by her (Lam. 2:15) Shall hiss and (Nah. 3:19) shake his fist.
(The Wickedness of Jerusalem) Woe to her who is rebellious and polluted, To the oppressing city!
She has not obeyed His voice, She has not received correction; She has not trusted in the LORD, She has not drawn near to her God.
(Ezek. 22:27) Her princes in her midst are roaring lions; Her judges are (Jer. 5:6; Hab. 1:8) evening wolves That leave not a bone till morning.
Her (Hos. 9:7) prophets are insolent, treacherous people; Her priests have polluted the sanctuary, They have done (Ezek. 22:26; Mal. 2:7, 8) violence to the law.
The LORD is righteous in her midst, He will do no unrighteousness. Every morning He brings His justice to light; He never fails, But (Jer. 3:3) the unjust knows no shame.
“I have cut off nations, Their fortresses are devastated; I have made their streets desolate, With none passing by. Their cities are destroyed; There is no one, no inhabitant.
